safety_precautions: Be cautious not to pinch fingers when using the clamp.

steps.description: Inspect the loose leg to identify the cause of looseness. This may be due to unscrewed screws or wear and tear on the wood.
If the screws are loose, tighten them using the screwdriver. If this doesn't fix the issue, proceed to the next step.
If the wood is worn, apply wood glue to the affected area. Clamp the leg to hold it in place while the glue dries.
Let the glue dry as per the instructions on the glue packaging.
Once the glue is dry, remove the clamp. Use sandpaper to smooth any rough edges.
Clean the repaired area with a cloth.

tips: Keep the chair in a dry area while the glue is drying.
If the leg is severely damaged, consider replacing it with a new one.
